alert.note: Alert for Macomb (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 26 at 3:28PM EDT until July 26 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: The National Weather Service in Detroit/Pontiac has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Macomb County in southeastern Michigan... * Until 430 PM EDT. * At 327 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Milford to near Livonia to Wyandotte, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Warren around 340 PM EDT. Sterling Heights and Clinton around 350 PM EDT. St. Clair Shores and Mount Clemens around 355 PM EDT. Romeo around 400 PM EDT. New Baltimore around 405 PM EDT. Armada around 410 PM EDT. Richmond and Memphis around 415 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Roseville, Shelby Township, Ray Center, Utica, Fraser, Eastpointe, Washington, New Haven, Stoney Creek Metro Park and Center Line. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
